name: japchae
description: Dangmyeon (sweet potato noodles) stir-fried with vegetables.
intro: The bright, colourful Korean noodle dish made with an abundance of vegetables, juicy bits of marinated pork and a sesame-forward dressing. Made with sweet potato noodles which have a unique slippery, chewy texture, this is sort of a stir fry, sort of a noodle salad.
steps: Soak shiitake mushrooms in warm water for 2-3 hours, then slice into thin strips.
Slice pork belly into thin strips.
Marinate pork strips and shiitake mushrooms in garlic, sugar, a pinch of pepper, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Set in fridge for at least 30 minutes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Put the noodles into the boiling water, cover and cook for 1 minute. Stir them with a wooden spoon so they don’t stick together. Cover and keep cooking for another 7 minutes until the noodles are soft and chewy.

Strain and cut them a few times with kitchen scissors. Put the noodles into a large bowl. Add 2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil, 1 teaspoon soy sauce, and 1 teaspoon sugar. Mix well by hand or a wooden spoon.

Heat up a skillet over medium high heat. Add 2 teaspoons vegetable oil with the onion, scallion, and a pinch of salt. Stir-fry about 2 minutes until the onion looks a little translucent. Transfer to the noodle bowl.
Add all cooked ingredients to a mixing bowl. Add garlic, soy sauce, sugar, pepper, and sesame oil. Mix by hand.
Transfer to a large plate and serve warm or cold.
